com.mad.p03.np2020.routine.Focus.Adapter

Class AchievementAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<AchievementViewHolder>
      • com.mad.p03.np2020.routine.Focus.Adapter.AchievementAdapter

  • public class AchievementAdapter
extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<AchievementViewHolder>
    Achievement Adapter to handle the recyclerView Achievement Activity The achievementAdapter will inflate the the items for the sections to which will give us the view from will be passed to the view holder AchievementViewHolder In here you will be able to see the 3 category of the achievements that is retrieve from google firebase
    Since:
    01-08-2020

      • onCreateViewHolder

        @NonNull
public AchievementViewHolder onCreateViewHolder(@NonNull
                                                         android.view.ViewGroup parent,
                                                         int viewType)
        Specified by:
        onCreateViewHolder in class androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<AchievementViewHolder>
        Parameters:
        parent - The ViewGroup is the parent view that will hold your cell that you are about to create. So, the ViewGroup parent is the RecyclerView here (it will hold your cell). The parent is used during the layout inflation process so you can see it passed in to the inflate call.
        viewType - The viewType is useful if you have different types of cells in your list. For example, if you have a header cell and a detail cell. You can use the viewType to make sure that you inflate the correct layout file for each of those two types of cells.
        Returns:
        return the Viewholder that is created within the onCreateViewHolder method
